column3:
utACK 0fdf810d267928b4c26a2e2cbb8c02b79e7b0ccb.
We should think about adding a confirmation-target to `fundrawtx`, though we could argue that the custom `feerate`-option (recently added) in conjunction with `estimatesmartfee` should be sufficient.

Also, AFAIK, there is no runtime option to change the default confirmation target requiring users using `sendto***` RPC calls to restart bitcoind in

> Also, AFAIK, there is no runtime option to change the default confirmation target requiring users using sendto**\* RPC calls to restart bitcoind in order to change the confirmation target.\n\nI'm not so happy about RPC calls changing (specific) global defaults. The way `-paytxfee` and `payTxFee` is handled has always bothered me. If we're going to allow changing global configuration parameters t

> I'm not so happy about RPC calls changing global defaults. The way -paytxfee and payTxFee is handled has always bothered me.

Yes. A runtime change is probably undesirable.
But a per-send custom confirmation target via `sendto*` could be possible. Though it would be probably the 7 parameter in row after `subtractFeeFromAmount` (reminds me that we should not forget about https://github.com/bit

> But a per-send custom confirmation target via sendto\* could be possible.

Yes, `sendtoadress` is a mess (indeed, #8811 with named arguments would help there). `fundrawtransaction` however already has a parameters object passed in, so this could just be added?

> fundrawtransaction however already has a parameters object passed in, so this could just be added?

Yes. But somehow it's already possible:

```
x = estimatesmartfee(<conftarget>)
fundrawtransaction <rawtx> '{"feeRate":x}
```
